data.title: Pediatric Emergency and Urgent Care
data.meta_description: Your little one is in good hands at AdventHealth for Children. Our kid-friendly emergency rooms offer advanced technology and treatments, along with a compassionate, whole-person approach. Learn more about our world-class emergency medical care for children.
data.text:
Focused on Kids

Our dedicated children’s emergency locations are designed with kids in mind. Our rooms are child-friendly and scare-free, so your child feels safe and comfortable with our teams. And we can even customize the lighting with our special Phillips Ambient Experience system.

Locations include:

AdventHealth for Children in Orlando

AdventHealth Celebration

AdventHealth Daytona Beach

AdventHealth East Orlando

Creating a Soothing Experience

Even at our hospitals that see adult and children patients, we’ve taken steps to ensure your child’s comfort. Emergency departments have a separate, child-friendly waiting room and a pediatric triage room to help expedite your visit. Our themed exam rooms also help ease the stress of your visit.

Our child-friendly emergency locations include:

Centra Care Kids

Centra Care Kids, AdventHealth for Children’s Urgent Care, provides trusted, convenient pediatric medical treatment for minor illnesses and injuries. Our AdventHealth for Children board-certified pediatricians will treat infant patients (from birth) to 21 years of age. Now with two locations in Lake Mary and Winter Park, Kids' Urgent Care is open exclusively after-hours, seven days a week. Learn More

Centra Care

With over 30 locations, Centra Care is AdventHealth's only hospital-affiliated urgent care provider. Our board-certified pediatric-trained physicians are accessible when you need us, seven days a week, with some centers open until midnight. For non-life-threatening medical care, Centra Care is the affordable alternative to the emergency room. Learn More

When you’re not feeling well, you can speak with a doctor or nurse practitioner without leaving your house. Our providers offer virtual appointments 24/7 for many minor injuries and illnesses, including:

Conjunctivitis/pink eye

Cough, colds, bronchitis and flu

Lower back pain

Seasonal allergies

Sinus and upper-respiratory infections

Skin conditions

Urinary tract infections

Hours: Available seven days a week, 24 hours a day. No appointment is needed.

How It Works

Download the AdventHealth app on the App Store or Google Play.

Create an account.

Tap the "Request Visit" link in your app

Your care is just a click away. Get started today.

Hopefully, your trip to the emergency room will be the only medical attention your child will need. But if an injury or condition requires further treatment, our care navigators will help connect you with follow-up care wherever you live.

Your family has access to more than 250 pediatric specialists practicing in 35 subspecialties dedicated to healing children. As part of our mission to provide whole-person care, we're here to heal your body, ease your mind and lift your spirit.

Our Children's Health Navigation team is made up of registered nurses who help guide you through our network and assist with scheduling appointments, finding pediatric specialists and medical questions.

Welcome to a unique concept in emergency care — one that recognizes how important it is to help young children feel safe and confident while being evaluated and receiving treatment for a serious medical issue. If you’ve ever seen the Walt Disney World Pavilion at AdventHealth for Children you know how dedicated we are to creating an environment that feels welcoming to kids. Our kid-friendly emergency rooms are no exception, providing everything from lights that can be adjusted to your child’s favorite color to engaging artwork with animals and characters that kids love.

When Sebastian was just one week old, his parents knew something wasn’t quite right. His mother noticed changes in his behavior and weight. So, they brought him to the pediatric emergency department at AdventHealth Celebration. Shortly after arriving, Sebastian stopped breathing. Our pediatric specialists quickly stabilized Sebastian before transferring him to AdventHealth for Children. There, doctors found that Sebastian had a congenital heart condition called supraventricular tachycardia, which causes his heart to beat abnormally fast. Now, with regular medication and monitoring, Sebastian can live a happy and normal life — all because a mother trusted her gut.
